title: Mediocrity In Lore Design
body: Is it just me or is every champion that comes out now have a very short lore. With all of Jhin's teasers for example I expected to see much more than I did, though to see one measly paragraph that explained next to nothing. I miss the days of old where a Lore page would take 10-15 minutes to read because it was so detailed, it was amazing. Now it has dwindled down to a quick skim. {{champion:202}}

replies.body:
*sigh*

http://gameinfo.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/champions/jhin/#champion-lore

These questions just keep popping up. Well at least I can educate folks one at a time. Lore's only on the website now. Client won't tell you sod.
Omg I feel so stupid. Thank you so much for this, and i'm sorry if this was a bother I had no clue xD.
It's not a bother from you personally, it's just this question keeps popping up and has been more frequent as of late, so it's a tad tiring. Nothing bad on you, just this is a persistent thing.

We know it's not ideal, and it's not meant to be the end state in how each Champion will be introduced. I completely understand the frustration at the limitations of the current set-up. I can't go into much more right now, but we're very much aware of it.

Can't you just add a "visit the official site for more" to the short lore?
I mean I can understand that bigger changes to solve this might require some tech,but I think a simple additional sentence at the end of the short lore would already help to clear a lot of confusion about this.

Oh no Jaredan, it's not the format, limitations or method I have issue with, it's mostly just me being a bit annoyed of having to explain it to other people! I am wondering where that link from client to website idea went though, I mean I'd assume it's just you waiting on the client to get updated to be better, but I dunno.

I'd suggest making a thread and stickying it to tell people about the current direction, known issues and where to find lore in the current format, just to help alleviate some confusion for those not in the know.

I get you, Sharjo, but the reason explanation is needed is due to the current limitations. Good idea on the sticky. To be honest, part of the reason there isn't already something there to take care of it is of discussions that have been occurring recently and I don't want to speak definitively on certain things I'm not able to yet.

There should be something to help though and I'll sort it out when I'm back in the office.

Wasn't there suppose to be a link to the long lore that goes along with the summary in client?
I guess issues got in the way.Or you guys are saving it till the new client (the one mentioned during preseason) starts rolling out.
Can't we have a link in the champion preview in te client?

> [{quoted}](name=Jaredan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=j25A9nL2,comment-id=0000000000000002,timestamp=2016-02-04T01:22:20.753+0000)
>
> We know it's not ideal, and it's not meant to be the end state in how each Champion will be introduced. I completely understand the frustration at the limitations of the current set-up. I can't go into much more right now, but we're very much aware of it.

I'm going to assume new client means in client lore will be possible
Okay well thank you I wasn't aware of that xD
I think it is kinda weird that so many actually don't find the jhin bio considering that there is an announcement in the client called "Champion Bio:Jhin"

I honestly think it's down to the fact that there's very few people who frequent the website without being directed there by a news site like Surrender@20. People see a paragraph in the client and don't think to take a look elsewhere.

I can honestly say I do that. The only thing I ever read really is the Patch Notes and anything that is in the client. I only visit Surrender@20 to read Public Beta Information, though I never even thought to use it for Live information. But yes you are right as well, most people wouldn't think to look at the website (obviously) because really unless its in your face you think its not there, such as I did.
To be completely honest with you I never even saw it, which makes me feel kind of stupid for putting this on the board xD. I'll know better for next time.

Well now this isn't a complaint for me anymore which makes me happy, i've recently joined the forums and would like to begin Suggestions such as Concepts, i've already posted one for a new map if you'd like to check it out. I'm very interested in sharing my ideas with the community and hope I get some great feedback =).
Always good to see more folks get active within the community =)
Not your fault at all, no worries. We need to do better to make finding things easier.

this goes especially for the non current stuff. Old event Lore especially is hard to find.
And a lot of World setting isn't even known outside of Riot.

A World map and description of the major areas would be nice for example.

There are many videos for this,

Check out Necrit on youtube, i will try to refind stuff, but i know ive seen many major maps, ill come back to u with this

I could get into the lore right here but that might take to long and people might get bore

Yes, Fan made, there is a lot. But this was about official resources.

What I mean, when you go to Riot website there is a lot about gameplay, but nothing really about Setting and Story unless there is  afresh Newspost about something.

Champion bios are the only thing that you can easily find.

Also even Necrin is mostly recounting the old info we got before lore collapsed. A lot of that isn't entirley solid anymore. Even the old Worldmap doesn't hold anymore.
fair point, the basic basis of the lore is still there tho, its not been entirely disproven, the stuff that still holds will probably be changed tho u r right
You shouldn't feel stupid. You shouldn't have to go to the website to find the lore with no links to it in the client.

Yea the lore is a pretty big fail all around - Riot knows how to do teasers well but when the champ releases I'm just like oh, ok. Not impressed with the lore or the champion. Now I stick to fanfictions for my read - they are usually written better with more original ideas and insights than Riot can create.

Riot Lore = Best Lore.

Don't believe me? Look at my name and reconsider.
